title: Never Touched Me [1919] Directed By Alfred J. Goulding

sources.title: Never Touched Me 1919 Directed By Alfred J. Goulding
sources.description: Never Touched Me Directed by Alfred J. Goulding Produced by Hal Roach Starring Harold Lloyd Production company Rolin Films Distributed by Pathe Exchange Release date July 27, 1919 Country United States Language Silent (English intertitles ) Never Touched Me is a 1919 American short comedy film featuring Harold Lloyd . [ 1 ] A print exists in the Staatliches Filmarchive. [ 2 ] Plot Harold is one of several suitors attempting to woo Bebe. Several fights break out among the hopefuls at Bebe's home. Eventually she and Harold leave quickly on foot while being hotly pursued by the rest. Bebe leads Harold into a cafe where she is a dancer billed as "The Princess of Sapphire". Harold is mistaken as an orchestra leader and comically leads the band in a tune, all the while trying to avoid being struck by a trombonist's instrument . The most belligerent of Harold's rivals eventually puts him is a violent choke hold after he sees Harold come out of Bebe's dressing room. Harold is rescued by the police who inform him that the suitor who was choking him was a wanted man. Cast Harold Lloyd Snub Pollard Bebe Daniels Sammy Brooks Lige Conley (as Lige Cromley) Billy Fay Lew Harvey Wallace Howe James T. Kelley Noah Young See also Harold Lloyd filmography References 1 SilentEra entry 2 Progressive Silent Film List: Never Touched Me
